main.messages module¶

main.messages.new_goods_subscribers_notification(goods, profile)¶

This function sends an email about newly created goods to subscribed users.

Parameters

  • goods (class 'main.models.Goods') – a Goods object which was created

  • profile (class 'main.models.Profile') – a Profile object who need to send an email

main.messages.new_goods_subscribers_weekly_notification(goods, profile)¶

This function sends an email about new goods to a provided user.

Parameters

  • goods (class 'main.models.Goods') – a Goods object which was added

  • profile (class 'main.models.Profile') – a Profile object who need to send an email

main.messages.send_sms_to_number(to_number, sms_text)¶

This function sends SMS with a provided text to a provided phone number.

Parameters

  • to_number (str) – a phone number where to send text

  • sms_text (str) – Text that will be sent

main.messages.send_welcome_email(user)¶

This function sends a welcome email to a newly registered user.

Parameters

user (class 'django.contrib.auth.models.User') – a User object who need to send an email

main.models module¶

class main.models.Category(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This class describes how to store and operate data about a Goods category.

name - a name of a category

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

goods_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

name¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
class main.models.Goods(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This class describes how to store and operate data about goods.

SIZES - a tuple with possible sizes of a good that using for choice in a size field name - a name of a good description - a long text description which will be displayed in a detailed view seller - foreign key of a seller of this good weight - a weight of a good category - foreign key of a category of this good manufacturer - a manufacturer of this good tags - foreign keys of a tags of this good size - a size of this good rating - a current user’s rating of a good price - a current price discount - a current discount provided by a seller image - a photo of this good creation_date - a date when a good had been created views_counter - a current views counter

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

SIZES = (('S', 'Small'), ('M', 'Medium'), ('L', 'Large'))¶
category¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

tags¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class main.models.Profile(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This class describes how to store and operate data about user’s profiles.

user - a foreign key of a user linked to this profile phone_regex - a regexp validator for phone number phone_number - a phone number for notifications is_phone_confirmed - a boolean flag which indicates that a phone number was confirmed birth_date - a bith date of a user avatar - user’s uploaded profile pic subsciber - a foreign keys of user’s subscriptions

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

avatar¶

Just like the FileDescriptor, but for ImageFields. The only difference is assigning the width/height to the width_field/height_field, if appropriate.

birth_date¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

create_user_profile(instance, created, **kwargs)¶

This method creates a new linked Profile object when a user signs up.

Parameters

  • sender (class 'django.contrib.auth.models') – User class

  • instance (class 'django.contrib.auth.models') – a newly created user object

  • created – a boolean flag which indicates that an object was just

created :type created: bool

This method returns an absolute URL to a user’s profile.

a URL to a user’s profile page

subsciber¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

user¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

class main.views.GoodsCreate(**kwargs)¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.mixins.PermissionRequiredMixin, django.views.generic.edit.CreateView

This class provides a view for creating a new ‘Goods’ object.

permission_required - a name of required permission to access this page login_url - a redirect URL for a case when a user is not authorized or authenticated redirect_field_name - a parameter passed to URL in a case of redirection model - model of a view template_name - a template that will be used for a page rendering form_class - model form class

form_class¶

alias of main.forms.GoodsCreateUpdateForm

form_invalid(form)¶

This overridden method returns a response with a template rendered with the given context. The context contains a form with found errors.

Parameters

form (class 'main.forms.GoodsCreateUpdateForm') – form with user’s data

form_valid(form)¶

This overridden method saves form’s data to DB and returns a response with redirection to a detailed page of a created ‘Goods’ object.

Parameters

form (class 'main.forms.GoodsCreateUpdateForm') – form with user’s data

get_context_data(**kwargs)¶

This overridden method provides additional context data like a user’s avatar, a form, and information about CSS classes of form’s fields to a response.

get_success_url()¶

This overridden method provides URL for a detailed view of a newly created ‘Goods’ object.

class main.views.GoodsDetail(**kwargs)¶

Bases: django.views.generic.detail.DetailView

This class provides a detailed view of a ‘Goods’ model.

queryset - a query dict containing ‘Goods’ objects context_object_name - a name by which objects can be available in a template

context_object_name = 'goods'¶
get(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

This overridden method returns a rendered template of ‘Goods’ detailed view. It also provides a views counter calculation with saving results in cache.

Parameters

request (class 'django.http.request.HttpRequest') – user’s request object

class main.views.GoodsList(**kwargs)¶

Bases: django.views.generic.list.ListView

This class provides a list-based view for a ‘Goods’ model.

model - model of a view paginate_by - number of objects displayed on one page context_object_name - a name by which objects can be available in a template

context_object_name = 'goods_list'¶
get_context_data(**kwargs)¶

This overridden method provides additional context data like a user’s avatar and available tags to a response.

get_queryset()¶

This overridden method provides a queryset filtered by tag if a request contains a ‘tag’ parameter.

alias of main.models.Goods

paginate_by = 9¶
class main.views.GoodsUpdate(**kwargs)¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.mixins.PermissionRequiredMixin, django.views.generic.edit.UpdateView

This class provides a view for updating an existing ‘Goods’ object.

permission_required - a name of required permission to access this page login_url - a redirect URL for a case when a user is not authorized or authenticated redirect_field_name - a parameter passed to URL in a case of redirection model - model of a view template_name - a template that will be used for a page rendering form_class - model form class

form_class¶

alias of main.forms.GoodsCreateUpdateForm

form_invalid(form)¶

This overridden method returns a response with a template rendered with the given context. The context contains a form with found errors.

Parameters

form (class 'main.forms.GoodsCreateUpdateForm') – form with user’s data

form_valid(form)¶

This overridden method saves form’s data to DB and returns a response with redirection to a detailed page of an updated ‘Goods’ object.

Parameters

form (class 'main.forms.GoodsCreateUpdateForm') – form with user’s data

get_context_data(**kwargs)¶

This overridden method provides additional context data like a user’s avatar, a form, and information about CSS classes of form’s fields to a response.

get_success_url()¶

This overridden method provides URL for a detailed view of a newly created ‘Goods’ object.

login_url = '/accounts/login/'¶

permission_required = 'main.change_goods'¶
post(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

This overridden method checks a form’s data and updates with it linked ‘Goods’ object if data is valid or returns this form with found errors.

class main.views.PhoneConfirmation(**kwargs)¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.mixins.LoginRequiredMixin, django.views.generic.edit.FormView

This class provides a view for a ‘phone confirmation’ page.

login_url - a redirect URL for a case when a user is not authenticated redirect_field_name - a parameter passed to URL in a case of redirection model - model of a view form_class - model form class template_name - a template that will be used for a page rendering success_url - a URL of a ‘phone confirmed’ page

form_class¶

alias of main.forms.PhoneConfirmForm

get(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

This overridden method checks if a user’s phone number was confirmed and sends a confirmation code if it’s not. Otherwise, it redirects to a ‘phone confirmed’ page.

Parameters

request (class 'django.http.request.HttpRequest') – user’s request object

This overridden method provides the availability of a request’s data to a form.

form_class¶

alias of main.forms.UserForm

form_invalid(user_form, profile_form_set)¶

This overridden method returns a response with a template rendered with the given context. The context contains forms with found errors.

Parameters

  • user_form (class 'main.forms.UserForm') – form with user’s data

  • profile_form_set (class 'main.forms.ProfileFormSet') – form with user’s data

form_valid(user_form, profile_form_set)¶

This overridden method saves data in forms to DB and returns a response with redirection to a successful URL.

Parameters

  • user_form (class 'main.forms.UserForm') – form with user’s data

  • profile_form_set (class 'main.forms.ProfileFormSet') – form with user’s data

get(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

This overridden method gets a ‘User’ object linked with ‘Profile’ and returns a rendered template of a ‘Profile’ update view.

This overridden method provides additional context data like a user’s avatar and forms to a response.

This overridden method provides URL for an update view of a linked user’s ‘Profile’.
